alert.note: Alert for Klamath (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 02 at 12:44PM PDT until May 06 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Oregon... Sprague River near Beatty affecting Klamath County. .Rises on the Sprague River at Beatty continue due to snowmelt. More showers and thunderstorms are possible through late this week. For the Sprague River...including Beatty...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast to continue. * WHERE...Sprague River near Beatty. * WHEN...Until Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, flooding of structures along the Sprague River in the vicinity of Sprague River, Lone Pine, and down stream can be expected. Widespread agricultural flooding is likely in this area as well. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 PM PDT Tuesday the stage was 8.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:15 PM PDT Tuesday was 8.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 8.8 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall late tomorrow morning. This oscillation with the river rising and falling will continue for the next couple of days. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.8 feet on 02/02/1963. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 330 AM PDT.
